title: Bug 7581: ComboBoxCellEditor does not size correctly in property sheet
description: From ECJoe Winchester <JoeWin@us.ibm.com wrote in message news:3C407F76.31A82113@us.ibm.com...
OB:
When using the PropertySheetViewer, the ComboBoxCellEditor does not size correctly in the property sheet. If any of the strings in the drop-down list are wider than the width of the property sheet column, the combo box grows to be the width of the largest item. The issue is that the drop-down button may now be too far to the right and off the visible area of the property sheet, causing it to be clipped.

From a user's perspective, they can no longer see the drop-down button unless they make the property sheet view wider.
EB: The ComboBoxCellEditor should size correctly in the property sheet, taking into account the width of the drop-down list and ensuring that the drop-down button remains visible within the property sheet.
SR:
How to reproduce:
1. Open the PropertySheetViewer.
2. Edit an object that uses ComboBoxCellEditor for a property.
3. Ensure that the strings in the drop-down list are wider than the width of the property sheet column.
4. Observe that the combo box grows to accommodate the width of the widest item.
5. Verify that the drop-down button is no longer visible within the property sheet due to being clipped.

Expected behavior:
The ComboBoxCellEditor should size correctly in the property sheet, ensuring that the drop-down button remains visible even when the width of the drop-down list exceeds the width of the property sheet column.
